Table of contents » Wang-Landau method with WLRun

Extra options for Wang Landau iterations

  • --n_stages or -ns : How often the Wang Landau multiplicative factor is updated. Example: --n_stages 8
  • --energy_range or -er : Initial range for energy histogram in ProFASi energy units. Example: -er 20 80
  • --number_of_bins or -nb : Number of bins in the energy histogram at initialisation. Example: -nb 100
  • --flatness_cutoff or -fc : The fraction of the population of the most occupied bin, that the least occupied bin can trail by, for the energy histogram to be considered flat. Example: -fc 0.2
  • --initial_wl_factor or -gf0 : The initial value for the multiplicative factor used to update the density of states in one bin when the simulation enters it. The default value is e (2.718281828459045) as in the original Wang Landau article. But it can be set to something else using this option.
  • --use_htmc or -htmc : Whether or not to use the high temperature Monte Carlo to decorrlate when the simulation goes beyond the upper bound of energy. It is not set by default. So, if the energy exceeds the upper bound the update is rejected, and the system stays where it was, unless you use this switch. Example : --use_htmc
